name: Michael Hamilton
text: Its centrally located by the epic church and Pitts and Zanity, they are nice people to a degree. Sometimes you may need to make an appointment,  but usually you can walk-in and be seen.

name: David Goodwin
text: Slow very slow today alot of folks

name: Teresa Ann Smith
text: Great. Very helpful. Morgan county in Decatur Social security are very helpful

name: Ana Thornton
text: I have been on hold waiting to speak to someone for 55 mins this is ridiculous

name: David justice
text: They were very helpful and answered my questions the best they could.

name: Jonathan Scott
text: I'm try again tomorrow

name: MJan Holt
text: Quick, except at lunchtime...

name: Tammie Busby
text: friendly, helpful

text: friendly, helpful

name: Claudette Cole
text: I went online to get my replacement card, when I couldn't get through, the only reason why I put 5 stare is cause I went on SSA.com and got my card and it only took me a week. Sign up on the website.  It's guaranteed!

name: Bonnie bracey
text: The most unprofessional, uninformed group of people answering the phones. Have not been able to get my babies social security card because of wrong information given by everyone! Good luck getting a social security card during the"pandemic". Why they can't open up is beyond me.

name: Skeeter Young
text: horrible service, they will NOT answer their phones

name: Gabbiy Calvaria
text:
Rude and offer no help at all.
It’s pulling teeth to get them to answer any question.
They act like doing their job is the most inconvenient thing in the world.
Useless.

name: W Peters
text: Identify theft at its best! Go here and a crook can walkout with dozens of stolen ID!!! NO PRIVACY when signing in or NO PRIVACY when talking to a rep! This is wrong! It's no one's business what we are there for!!! Make it so no one can hear what we are discussing!!! HONOR OUR PRIVACY! How can we save guard our info if the Gov office is NOT!

name: Randall Cobb
text: I dont. Hate. The. Place.. People. There. Handle. Everything. Good spirits.

name: Mrs. D
text: Checked in at 10:30a, was sitting with an agent by 10:35a! The agent was friendly and the whole process was quick. Would definitely go back here again if I needed to.

name: Erik Fedde
text: It's closed. You can call a 1-800 number but it's not very helpful.

name: Joe rankin
text: Very friendly..helpful staff..Tim is awesome

name: Martha Anderton
text: I came in a bit frustrated for several reasons.  But everyone was so nice and extremely helpful.  I was hoping for just an appointment but actually got everything taken care of.

name: Anya Gorovaya
text: Very friendly staff. Especially nice man up front. Very helpful. I wish all government places were the same easy and helpful.

name: Regina Lavender
text: It's location is great! Easy too navagate! Parking space is always available and service is faster!

name: Changes Perry
text: Everyone was friendly and professional. They all treat you so much better than the downtown Birmingham office personnel.

name: Dionne Fields
text:
US Social Security Administration Retirement, Survivors, and Disability Insurance.
Whenever someone loses a love one, it takes a toll on the families heart and emotional wear being.
My oldest son lost his dad, In December 2006 and every Christmas my son still grieve his father death.
US Social Security Administration help me get Survivors Insurance for my son after his dad had died.
Thanks Linda S. Mc Mahon Deputy Commissioner for operations, for going above and beyond customer service for me and my grieving child

name: Kristen McKee
text: After all of the horror stories I've heard about unfriendly employees and the wait times at SSA offices- I was wonderfully surprised in Trussville. Everyone was really friendly and I was in and out in 15 minutes!!! I'd definitely recommend going here as opposed to downtown.

name: Juan g.a
text: Friendly people they there job correctly. It took about an hour to get seen but the job was done right .thank you

name: Kamela S. Spivey
text: Employees are polite and very helpful; it's easy to get things handled here and go.

name: Bobbie Bentley
text: I'm not in the state of  Alabama but I'm  told it's a good place to stay I live in Florida

name: Beaster Beast mode music UHBM
text: They did not reset my disability appointment, when they clearly stated June'1 of this month, that I will have one they recall wasn't in the system poor record file. Then that's when I said ok well let me get my social sercurity card since I didnt have one. I'm right now calling to see what's the problem.

name: S V
text:
I really do not think it is fair to Deny a person with an auto immune disease. Rheumatoid Arthritis  is a very hard disease to live with. Especially when it is crippling. Having flare ups that last weeks at a time is emotionally draining. Don't forget to add on being bipolar doesn't help.
But naw, we do not deem you disabled. Very hurtful especially when i know someone that got approved for "panic attacks" and lied about having depression in order to receive benefits. That is WRONG!

name: Sabrina Mauldin
text: Trussville office is good and fast

name: Marvellus Prater
text: They are oranized and efficient

name: Dricilla Gulley
text: I have visited this location 3 times and each time I have been the wait was never more than 10 minutes.  I choose to go to this site every time.

name: Linda Brodrecht
text: Could not do anything do always being locked it.

name: Jenna Isaacs
text: Clean. Fast. Friendly.

name: Allison Neal
text: Quick service!

name: Beckii Perea
text: Close to home

name: Shaden Hussein
text: After reading the bad reviews in here I thought I needed to write my own experience today. My husband and I had an appointment with them this morning and the manager Ms.Miller was the nicest and sweetest, she took her time to answer all our questions. I made several calls to this office and Ms.Tucker was the one answering my phone calls, so thankful for all her help. And I cant forget the security lady I believe her name was Linda was also very sweet, funny and friendly. Thankful for them!

name: Casey Benefield (Think A Little)
text:
Just got married. Trying to get the update for my wife. Person who answered the phone was needlessly abrasive. Not helpful at all. I'm looking for someone to email that call recording to. If I have to, I will email it to my representatives office. I understand karenvirus but this was not necessary.

Later a gentleman on the phone actually helped us. If it were a business..... It would not fly, but people think they untouchable, and that citizens are lowly peasants.

name: Ameer Kotadia
text: Worst office to work with.totally unprofessional.serms like like they dont even want to work.

name: Trac Vo
text: Hang up the phone 5 times in one day when I was explaining why I made phone call

name: W Myricks
text: The Social Security office is not open like webpage indicates. Closed due to Covid-19.

name: Marilyn Bowden
text: It was easy to find. Not a long wait

name: coldsteel key
text: My disability check was sent to a wrong account and when I call them to get help they lied told me what I wanted to hear just to get me off the phone,these people should be sued for lying to a disable person when they have no food and no money for medicine,and now they won't even answer the phone when I call or leave a message

name: J O
text: This branch is great. I went in to change my name after marriage and was in and out in ten minutes. I went on a Friday afternoon. Leonard was so helpful and nice. Would recommend this branch to anyone.

name: Nancy Hunter
text: The staff had attitudes for being at work, I had to tell her what I needed completed and why I could not fet a bank account until she gave me the form....which she never did and had to do a follow up to what she told me would be done later. Yes and wait time was awful....yet the hours for Wednesdays is 9-12... REALLY????? Truly wish and pray these services were better because it is our tax dollars at work.

name: Derek Kiley
text:
Very efficient service!! Everyone was very friendly and the wait time was very short!!
Great team!!

name: Caitlin Maddox
text: The WORST receptionist/security EVER.. She is loud, rude & has NO customer service! Sits on HER PHONE, talks to her friends leaning on the desk. Not sure what her name was but I received a call from the doctors office (currently pregnant) and it was urgent that I took this call. Instead of her POLITELY reminding that there were to be no calls made IN the WAITING AREA (where no confidential information is being discussed) she yells “MA’AM NO PHONE CALLS WHILE WAITING” singling me out. Whereas there is NO signage displayed with this “rule”. Would rather wait downtown or in Trussville for hours before dealing with this again.

name: APRIL SANDERS
text: I’ve never been until today.. but the process was quick and easy.. everyone was friendly!

name: jerry Smith
text: Website says they are open and I call. A recording says no one is available, and their most busiest times are early morning and the beginning of the month. Which at 1:15 on June 27 is neither early in the day or month. 😡

name: Pamela Collier
text: Spent 10 minutes going through their prompts and then was told that it would be a 55 minutes wait!  got to love our gov

name: Diana Owens
text: I've been waiting for my Backpay for 7 months now. They say my documents are not in the system and i have a copy of them being date time stamped. I've been to this office 3 times and they have no record of me. It doesn't make any sense and I highly recommend anyone go to a different office. Someone isn't doing their job.

name: Luay Salameh
text: The worst experience ever! Went to update my name after the citizenship and the person didnt save and sent me the same exact card. Went back after 2 weeks and they said sorry and updated the info but never sent me the card! I called and they asked me to come to that office again.. 3 visits to update my info! Its crazy!!! Its 45 min driving.. They need to pay attention and do their job.. Getting citizenship is easier that updating ur info OMG!!!!

name: Hai2u Official (Slim)
text: The customer service is horrible,  most of the time I do not get my problem resolved, resulting in a return.  The waiting area does not have enough seats for the capacity this office receives,  and they do not make it easy for the hard of hearing by allowing loud talking and not putting to use the monitor that lights up with the # being served.

name: A.J Jaskon
text: Really nice caring people here who whats to help

name: Renee Cospy
text: Very rude workers.. Somebody deserving of the jobs need them

name: Christy “Baby Girl” Brown
text: It has really nice people who take their time to help you , its Worth waiting for that to me. Christy Brown

name: Vanessa Wild Eagle
text: The customer service representatives are ok to deal with, but the security guard is a different story. Very rude Everytime I have been there. The wait times are horrible.

name: Frank Thrailkill
text: Got the answers I needed.

name: Kermit Earl Pleasant
text: Busy place,  but not as busy as the downtown office.

name: K
text: You wait awhile!

name: Chasity Gould
text: This social security office gives you the complete run around. First of all you have to get all these documents together from the doctors for your children and it has to say “this is a copy of the original” then you have to get forms from YOUR doctors because they don’t accept or copy of your id through the mail. Once you do that you have to print the application, sign it, and send it off. It took me a whole day to round up documents and print out forms. Let people put on mask, and open up the building! It’s ridiculous,It’s the middle of 2021. Everywhere else is OPEN

name: Aundrea Michelle
text: Ive been waiting 3 weeks on new ss card processed by Nicholas Solero..called spoke with him and he was so rude, kept interrupting me, wouldnt let me speak to manager. I hope call is recorded called 2day aroyns 3:30-3:40 i told him he was being rude and he said if he its its bc i wabt it to escalate hes in wrong profession.

name: Teresa Burns
text: I  have dealt with the SS office at several different locations in different states and this one is by far the best one I have ever been to.  The workers there are professional and pretty efficient for the number of people who are usually there.  This is the only office I have been to that has not tried to pass the buck to someone else, instead they helped me find a solution and quite quickly.  I had a problem in Florida that I had worked on for over a year and just kept getting the run around, its always processing, check back in 30 days.  Within 2 months in Alabama at this office and my whole problem was solved.

name: krystal harris
text: They have horrible customer service and because of Covid expects people to go online then when you try to login it's saying something went wrong. Then you keep calling and they have you on the phone for 30mins wairing for someone just to hear that don't know what to do....

name: Trey Maker
text: Completely impressed by the proficiency of the Dothan office the two times I visited. Now the fight to get benefits, that's a TOTALLY different story. We have to urge our Senators and Congressmen to fight to increase Social Security funding and to make adjustments to the screening and approval process. It is a shame to have impairments preventing employment that take 18 months to receive relief. You can email our representatives about it. That is their job, to speak for us in Washington. And for those abusing the system, SHAME ON YOU. If you are able to work, stop scamming and get a job. You are wasting everyone's time.

name: Reva Rose
text:
The service once you get in was great. I first talked to
Nicholas. He  was very courteous and right to the point.  I then waited maybe 10 minutes and spoke with Ms. V. Smith. She asked many questions but was super and made me feel inportant. Thanks so much.

name: Linda Fryer
text: I know the ssoffice handle thousands of clients but their was absolutely no excuse for the treatment that I got from the social security office in Dothan Alabama I was yelled at, when I will call they would hang up on me, no return phone calls they acted as if I was a nuisance to them.everyone in the social security office on that day and time heard the supervisor over the whole building yelling at me, telling me that I had already received x amount of money. The judge awarded me this money the money was taken out of my check. I was told that if I had any outstanding bills or just bills need paying to fax it to the social security office and they would pay it. Well guess what she did not pay my bill. the fax was sent to them on the 17th for this bill and it never got paid until this Monday on the 3rd. Yes I'm mad as hell it's my money and I want it now

name: N M
text:
I am new to Medicare and Social Security benefits. In short, even for a government agency the Dothan SSA office is incompetent - and very expensive if you don't check up on everything they do. Anyone you talk to will tell you it is someone else's fault. That is, if you can hear them. Their phone system has the quality of two tin cans and a string. But they don't care.
But you cannot even try to talk to the person you need to, you have to leave a message - even though you can never understand the recorded message. Calls are rarely returned anyway.
I have always believed that incompetence starts at the top. Whoever manages this office should be replaced. Then work their way down the employee list.

name: Estela Flores
text: Kept getting my documents sent back 3x bc it was always “missing something” they’re too picky even after I had my legal documents. did not get the service I needed.  I will never use them again in the future.

name: Ivonne Traconis
text:
Ms. Eady was awesome! She was very helpful and kind besides she didn't let me go until she was quite sure I had everything right.
Thank you  Ms. Eady !!!

name: lilMalevolent
text: I would like to give them half a star, but it isn’t an option. The people are rude, and will not help anyone. They messed up on faxing important papers, and when someone over the phone gives out the wrong information, and all you want to do is speak to the supervisor in person. The damn social security officer wants to cause a scene. (No, contrary to belief, I was not rude nor was I harassing the teller.)

name: Brandy Helms
text: Very disappointed at how a action was handled in the line waiting outside the door before the office opened. I understand getting here a hour early to beat the line, but if you're not at the door technically you are not in line. And the pushing a lady's purse out of the way with your foot is very rude, just because you said you were here first. Well when the doors opened the security guard allowed several people to push the lady back while she was trying to tell him what was happening. I am reporting this because in my opinion this was not fair!!!

name: Judith L. Flieger
text: So far I’ve had to wait a hour and a half and am still waiting.  All I want to do is find out about is scams  that is going on now, as I just got a call saying they were going to come pick me up for something, I can’t remember what he said I did wrong. But I didn’t do anything wrong so I’m not worried, just thought I would find out if Social Security knew anything about this. Anyway they were going to put me in jail.  Still waiting.

name: Carla Johnson
text: Got me there amazingly! Best app ever

name: richard pearson
text: Fast and friendly. Thank you

name: Mrs Williamson
text: If I could give this place 0 stars I so would everytime I go there they are extremely RUDE never welcoming nothing😡😡😡😡

name: Andrea Toland
text: Its says closed and it ant 4 yet. Ive been on hold for 1hr

name: Thomas Boberg
text: They suck u can't never get in touch with who u need to they never answer the phone or never there

name: It's Me
text: People kind of rude

name: Rachel
text: Rude employees indeed. The information online for obtaining a new card for a child is not exactly straightforward so I called this office to verify. One man said I need shot records, SS5 form, and birth certificate.. that was yesterday. Ok, today I drive to the office and call asking if I can hand the paperwork to someone (I’m not mailing the original birth certificate that took me 8 months to get it). An employee named Willie answered and told me that only the supervisor was in the building and refuses to see anyone. First of all, every time I tried to speak to Willie I got interrupted. Secondly, Willie told me the shot records are no good that I need to have a letterhead with my child’s pediatrician verifying this and that to send in. Does any employee know what they are doing or do they just not care? I don’t appreciate getting the run around over documents the government requires my child to have. I’ll send in what I have and if there’s a problem I will be speaking to someone’s boss and it will not be pleasant.

name: Mason Dennis
text: The lady I deal with on the phone is rude, not helpful and completely unprofessional. Providing the best service and achieving excellence is obviously not a priority to this organization.

name: B Jackson
text: During the time I went I didn't have to wait long I got all my questions answered

name: Megan Hayes
text: Flat out rude employees.

name: Skyla Cheyanne
text: Absolutely rude no help what so ever.

name: Lexiss Gallegos
text: Just want everyone to know that the office is closed as of Tuesday March 17; there is no note on how long they will be closed.

name: Robbi & Lisa Stone
text: The SS employees were so fast and nice. I received my card that I filled for there in 3 days. So helpful. Thank you !!

name: Sharon Maze
text: I called for assistance to a question and Joyce, the Social worker, was pleasant and very kind.  Gave me the information I needed and told me to have a nice day!

name: fred b
text: Closed because of Covid. Nothing on the website about being closed.

name: Elizabeth Pierce
text: My husband and I went to get his information updated for his disability check. We were told that someone would call and finish the process. That was a week ago. When I called the staff was extremely rude. Twice. And gave us no information. If they refuse to do their jobs I don't know how we are going to pay the rent this month.

name: Linda Makary
text: Because don't have to worry about someone else Using my account

name: Melinda Hairston
text: My bother has a severe learning disabilitie and can't read or spell. He had reserved a letter and some papers fill out so he went to the office to get help filling them out. When he got to the window to get help the men said can't you read to do this your self when my bother said he couldn't the man laughed and sent him home told him to get family to do it for him. I called the office the next day told them what happened and ask why that didn't help him they are supposed to have people on staff to help the disabled or any that don't speak  English. I was told they would get back to me they didn't.

name: Tristan Anderson
text: Sent for a card and they sent it back. Don’t understand.

name: Lisa Kay Hawkins
text: My experience was great..in and out in the nic of time.. But all I needed was my social security cards

name: Tiffany Long
text: Very rude not helpful and if they don't know something they do not even try and out  they. Just tell you to go home and they will call you when they find out

name: jimmy higdon
text: If I get paid I will

name: Liza Roberson
text: Not very helpful ask them a question and they can not give me answers only thing they say I don't know

name: Gina Turner (Mzmeanez)
text: Very helpful!!

name: Anastasia Ager
text: EXTREMELY rude staff

name: Brittny McVey
text: The person I spoke with today was very helpful! Exceeded my needs! Thank you so much!

name: Roshell Taunton
text: All of my questions were answered and I was completely helped with all needs.

name: Rebecca Hawkins
text: Some employees have an attitude, however there are some hard workers mixed in. THANK GOD I had one.

name: Megan Meister
text: It's almost like the office doesn't want to answer phones or help people.

name: Marvin Osborne
text: Pitiful very poor servivce....or should I say No service

name: Robert Rock
text: Very helpful.

name: Maria Mckee
text: Always have a good experience every time I go

name: randy owens
text: ive been calling all day long and cant get an answer. yall dont even update your website! its almost time to go over your head and contact higher authority.

name: Andrea Grant
text: No one ever answers the phone and rude!

name: Scottie Johnson
text: They are always helpful

name: rebecca young
text: Awesome experience !! Very friendly and helpful !!

name: Cleo Carpenter-Robinson
text: Short wait time

name: Latasha Williams
text: Great people

name: Chautsey Thomas
text: It’s so sad I was on hold for over 2 1/2 hours then the phone just hang up.. They really need help down there.

name: Tamie Savage
text: I really dont understand how EVERYTHING ELSE has opened up but the social security office! They could have put safety requirements in place and opened up. Why do they think people are okay with sending their original identification in to a place that's known to lose paperwork!!!

name: Emmanuel Hiveson
text: They are so so rude, unprofessional, and extremely loud. Ms Cole been on the phone twice with me already, and every single time she just talk over me when I’m trying to answer her questions. The Montgomery Social Security Office needs some work.

name: Aldona Szafraniak
text: I can’t belive they expected that I send my original documents to them. Some documents their requesting cost over $500 dollars to replace.

name: nita easterling
text: I had mrs poole to yell at me and  say she couldn't  help me but i did find one guy there who did so kudos to  you it took a few mnths though

name: LeeAnna Simmons
text: Workers are insensitive they will talk over you and cut you off as if you're nothing!!!! They need to know and understand they can be replaced also!!!!! I can't believe they have people like that working with people with disabilities and so forth to only be discriminated against and torn down. SAD SAD SAD

name: Shawna
text: So incredibly frustrating! Only need a SSN for my baby because I still haven’t received it after filling out the paperwork in the hospital months ago. After waiting an hour, they couldn’t help me, and you cannot make an appointment, fill out paperwork online or via mail for this request.

name: Virgo Vixen87
text: They need to do better!

name: Stephanie A. McCorvey
text: Extraordinary service, short wait time during the lunch hour; IF you're prepared with necessary documents.  Go to website first. Friendly staff at booth "I"

name: Stephanie McCormick
text:
Well, I gotta say, just like anything in life- your experience will be what you make it. Be patient. Plan ahead. Come prepared. This office deals with hundreds of customers daily, so expect a wait. Don’t get mad when you get in there, and there’s 30 ahead of you. Anticipating this will hopefully set your mind to be in better spirits to wait with the rest of us.
Have some empathy for the clerks people. No doubt they get dumped on by EVERY single person that walks up to their window. Customers who’ve waited and are tired, hungry, in pain, running late, impatient, frustrated... imagine being in their position before you walk up to the window. Be kind to them, and they’ll be good to you.
All of these piffy comments, judgmental jerks stereotyping all visitors as “waiting for a hand out”,... well- not surprised their experiences were unpleasant. Just sayin.

name: Juliette Johnson
text: Worker was late calling me. I got upset w her. While on phone w bank getting intro she State I need to get off the phone. She could've waited n got route # no later her attitude was very uncomfortable. I was nervous not a good experience. I walked out will ask to see some one else

name: Kristine Jones
text: Wonderful experience. The security officer was friendly, the person who checked us in was very nice, and the woman who helped answer our questions was amazing. She was thorough, kind, and exceptionally competent. It was the best experience I've ever had at a government office.

name: Kathy Griffin
text: I went to the office expecting to have to wait so my wait time didn't bother me.  The workers, except for the rent-a-cop, were all very professional & polite.  The rent-a-cop, during my visit, was a tall, middle-aged white guy that was a total jerk to everyone...he seems to enjoy being rude.  My only other complaint is that, if you have to bring your children, please control their behavior.  My parents managed to control mine, I controlled my own children & I expect others to do the same.

name: Tyreese Edwards
text: I HAVE NEVER HAD A GOOD EXPERIENCE THERE! THEY TAKE ALL DAY LONG! ALL OF THE WINDOWS ARE NEVER OPEN AND THE SECURITY GUARD IS VERY RUDE NOT TO MENTION #CERTAIN MEMBERS OF THE STAFF! LONG STORY SHORT IF YOU NEED TO GO BE PREPARED TO SIT ALL DAY LONG! NOT TO MENTION YOU CAN NEVER GET THROUGH THE PHONE LINES.  SMH. THERE HAS GOT TO BE SOMETHING THEY CAN DO TO MAKE IT RUN BETTER

name: Kendra Bryan
text: The staff members are rude and unable to answer questions with a proper answer.

name: Courtney Edwards
text: All I see is people complaining about others peoples kids and them running and being loud. You have to be one hell of a grouch to complain that children wont sit still and be quiet for such long wait periods that happen at the SSA. Children are wired to play it is not there intent to bother you however to expect a child to sit still especially young kids is ridiculous and to parent shame is bad on you. You don't know people's story , you don't know what is going on with them and honestly if you can keep your toddlers calm and quiet that long kudos to you. But all kids are different and if they are not physically accosting you get over yourself.

name: Dorisetta Moore
text: My experience today was pitful it brought shame to me as a Government worker myself. Yesterday I went in to get a replacement card with my son we had the wrong documents. My son's wallet was stolen do we are trying to get replacements. WRONG catching pure hell with SS office. Yesterday the man at the intake office and the 1800 number told me that I could use Medical Documents. I go get those this is also listed on the website. Today I go in and the intake man tells me, "oh no my people told you wrong we cannot use this. I told him my situation and he told me to take my documents to the probate office and get an ID. To make long story short Social Security is giving out different information concerning medical documents either you take medical documents or not if you take certain ones specify. Because leaving it up to Intake window you get confusing information. To be born in the USA it sure is hell getting a Social Security Card but someone sure can steal your identity boy I bet getting that Straight with these people will drive you crazy. Pitful

name: Thomas Downs
text: Confusing using number and letter for window.  Confusing numbering system.  Why!

name: Dale H
text: Wow!  Typical government agency customer service.  Slow and rude. And the security guard treats folks as it they are ignorant.  No signs to assist and 30 service windows that should be manned.  This is a two story building with probably over 100 employees which I would bet most are probably surfing the internet.  And how hard is it to control your kids so they don't run all over the place being loud.

name: Eddie Edwards
text: Do not go here if you have a job.  Customer service is the worst and the clientele are all waiting for their handout along with their brood. If that isnt bad enough, the rent a cop treats patrons like inmates.  Go to another office in a non janky town

name: Diana Powell
text: I had an 11:00 appointment and was seen at 12:30. Not a promotional bell ringer...

name: Tan #diamond
text: Take to longgggg , get there early u still have to wait a longggg time!

name: Jeongyeon Choi
text: Whatever you are doing in here, it takes forever.

name: Tim Thornell
text: When you walk through the doors there is a sign that points to the left and ask you to sign in at window 2 (or something) wellllllll, don't go left or else you will be sitting for an additional hour for no reason. The check in window will be straight in, across the sitting area. Don't waist your time asking the security guard anything unless you plan to ruin your mood for the rest of the day, HE IS A JERK AND I TOLD HIM SO. The check in window personnel was the friendliest but after that prepare to sit for awhile. My advice is to rub some VICK'S under your nose before going in. It seems the two times I've been in there are some visitors that come in that forget to shower and they can surely stink up the room. Sitting with that smell can certainly make for a long wait and your wait will most definitely be long. My advice to visitors is to make an appointment before going. My advice to SSI is to fire that JERK you call a gaurd and hire someone that's at least helpful and has the personality of at least a dead skunk in the middle of the road. I'm having to go back in this morning and I'll be certain to avoid this badged employee if at all possible. I pray this visit goes smoother than my past 2 and I'll pray yours does as well.

name: BYRDIE Yeah
text:
If you come early and their lobby is open, it doesn't matter if its cold or not they make stand outside in the cold or rain instead of in the lobby until the doors are open......
I don't like that at all period! People are old, people have disabilities and making people stand outside in all weather conditions is cruel!

name: Christopher Cordell
text: Spoke with the manager Mr Matos and he blatantly lied to my face then later hung up on me on the phone after being caught with discrimination. I'm filing a complaint and a lawsuit to follow

name: Laura Grover
text: I followed the instructions from the website, but when I got to the office the worker told me that the documents that I brought were not what they use.  When I told her that I printed the instructions and what they needed from the website she said “well we don’t use that”. Beyond frustrating.

name: Lindsay Jones
text: I was in and out in 15 minutes. They were fast and very friendly.

name: Kendell Willett
text: This place is a mess. Security officer was so rude and there definitely aren't enough people working.

name: STAN MB
text: If you are coming here plan to spend the entire day. It says no food or drinks allowed but please pack a snack or have a heavy breakfast. I have been here three time and the least amount of time I have spent is 2 hours .

name: Tarsha Stokes
text: It’s the person working there is so bad to there customers an her name is pooler she is so nasty an don’t know how to speak to a person I wouldn’t recommend anybody to go to her

name: carlos williams
text: Guy was very rude and had an abrasive arrogant attitude. He didn't listen to my request before cutting me off. Not friendly at all!!!

name: Debra Jackson
text: I found them to be helpful

name: Wendy Goff (wendalou)
text: They are better than before

name: Kizzy Pettiway
text: Very rude people very!

name: John Moore
text: Saved

name: Mohamed Alsaffar
text: Super Slow , Employees are rude  . only one Employee had to assist you initially. long line and It took us forever. Avoid going there

name: Traci Tillery
text: They suck they say we will call you but you don't hear anything from them

name: Tamika Mcclain
text: They are slow and rude and don't kno how to update your records are nothing and u have to talk to five people before you can get anything done

name: Emily Hubbard
text: I would like to thank the staff of this office. I have had a lot going on. I have filed SSI for my son and also got married and needed to change my name. Everyone I have spoken to over the phone has had great patience with me. I have had so many questions and each person took the time to answer my questions. I believe the people having difficulties and having employees hang up on them might need to re evaluate the way they treated or spoke to them first.  Thank you for your patience and dedication to keep our community going strong! 💜 May God bless everyone reading this!

name: Jackie Patrick
text: I would give a zero but  you can't so it has to be a 1 which is to much.  I need a 1099 for my father who is 92 years old and very very hard of hearing and can not understand much over the phone, they would not give me a 1099,  I have Power of Attorney but they don't recognize Power of Attorney.  I need it to file his taxes in case we get another stimulus so he would be eligible to qualified for one.  I didn't like the person I talked to he did not give a rip about my problem, but. Off course it was not one of this parents

name: Nancy Johnstone
text: Its website is terrible. I couldn’t login in as it kept saying it didn’t recognize my profile, demanding to login (or sign in) over and over, it never took me to anywhere. Well, my profile is OLD, but it won’t let change me a new one, it was too difficult to do! It once was helpful but not anymore!

name: Taylor Atwell
text: Due to COVID they are strictly on the phone or by mail, but they are the least helpful office I’ve experienced. Deal with the Mobile office they are far more helpful. I’ve sent in the correct forms to apply for a new card twice and it’s merely been sent back to me without any explanation. I’d understand if they were “in person” but they aren’t so they should step it up.

name: Chelsey Bryant
text:
Due to COVID, their office is not open for in person appointments. I had some questions about changing my name for my social because the print off papers state you need something different from what it states you need online. I called for clarification and immediately the woman who took my call was extremely rude and had an awful attitude and tone. She told me she “didn’t like pulling up the instructions and reading them verbatim but she would if I would like to read them along with her”. After telling her that I can in fact read and what the issue was, she cleared her attitude up just a little. Sorry to have wasted 5 minutes of your day ma’am.
Gave 2 stars only because I got the clarification I needed.

name: Amanda Outlaw
text: I’ve had to stay in touch with representatives over the phone. The people I have talked to have been rude and not helpful. I try to be really nice so I can get my information. They snap at you if you don’t understand what they are asking. I can’t wait until I don’t have to deal with them anymore.

name: Kathleen Wilde
text: I've been twice lately and both times the wait was very short, the staff pleasant and efficient.  Grateful!  :)

name: Patsy Shreve
text: I have been here for 2 1/2 hours. Saw a lady (Miss Wright) that couldn’t explain why I owed money. She was rude and impatient. She said she didn’t know why I owed the money and said I would have to talk to someone in the back to explain it to me. Been waiting another hour and still have not been called back to talk to someone...

name: Tiara Roberson
text: Lady in the office at the first window was so freaking rude to me and pretty much laughed in my face because I said I thought someone had and is using my social security number. She laughed and said no one had my social and that the things I brought in didn't prove anything, she had no reason to be that hateful to me. Hired IDShield the next day and they found the person who did in fact steal my social security number and they got everything fixed within an hour. So disrespectful for no reason, no one is making you work there, if you don't like the job and you don't want to help then leave.

name: Localanimal
text: I lost my check in Sept 1,2018 i try get back soon kaylene adams im using my France account on here

name: shannon Hatfield
text: Moved quickly the day I was there

name: Ginger Everett
text: Didn't  have to wait only 45 mins due to me that being early.

name: Daniel Scarcliff
text: My wait time was less than two minuets . All of the staff were knowledgeable and polite.  Yes, I did rate them a 5 star.

name: Bev Horn
text: You think about signing up for your Social Security benefits for many years.  When my time came it started off with misinformation from the national customer service and hours of frustrating back and forth.  But, as luck would have it,  when my husband and I made a trip to the Fairhope office  that all changed. OMG!! With the personal assistance and professional service of Britney and Cheryl it's done!!!  I mean what a joy and stress free!  Britney listened to us  to help and understand my situation from start to finish.  Then she directed us straight to Cheryl.  Cheryl's knowledge and experience was obvious from the first moment!  Thank you ladies!!  Thank you so much!!!

name: Frankie Conway
text: No one could answer what was asked. They act like they didn't care it was like I get paid so why worrying about you.

name: hrsala
text: Terrible. About what you would expect from Federal workers. Called to get a form. Nice lady said she would put form in envelope form with my name on it, and tell person at door to get the envelope at window 1.  Traveled to the SS office, person at door refused to go to window 1.  Said take a number, and wait 45+ minutes. Where do they find these people?

name: Jeffrey Shoemaker
text:
I just called the Fairhope, AL SS office and the phone was answered on the second ring by Meesha.

She was very attentive, knowledgable and helpful.  Nothing could have been better.  KUDOS to her!!

name: Kristi Bryant
text:
The security guard was very rude and disrespectful to everyone. Someone that came in didn't know they had to turn their phone down and instead of just asking them to turn it down he got really mad and rude.
When they call a # you can't understand them sometimes so a woman went and ask what # they called and he told everyone that the next person that just walked to the window was going to be thrown out but he wouldn't get off his but and ask them what # they were calling.
They need to get a new security guard for sure.

name: Hodge Stephenson
text:
I called the Social Security Office in Fairhope, Alabama this afternoon (12/02/2013) to ask a couple of questions.  Mr. Paul McLain took my call.  Mr. McLain asked a few security questions to ensure he was really talking with me.  I appreciated his doing this, because I realized that this was for my own protection.  Mr. McLain was very courteous and helpful.  He handled my questions in a most effecient manner, and even called me back with an answer to a question he had to research.  Kudos to Mr. McLain!!

Hodge Stephenson

name: David Roberts
text: This office is very professional.  The staff spends as much time as needed to help.  Wait time is 15-20 minutes or less.

name: eugene schermerhorn
text: Bad I had get SSC for I lost mine I checked on website for there hours and it said 9 am to 430 pm got there and on door it said 9 am to. 12 noon I really think they need to up date the web site that bad service for government

name: Dante Mendoza Ruelas
text: People are nice

name: Barnett Langford
text: I can't get through on the 800 line -- it keeps throwing me into marketing promotions and high pressure sales pitches!  And they just don't stop by pressing #!!

name: Jared Kimbler
text: Security guard is very rude not respectfull or nice at all

name: Bobo Hoho
text: The phone system is ridiculous in the people in person or very rude I called the place after 5 minutes of talking to a retarded robot they said I had to wait on hold for 40 minutes pure scam artist they must be lazy

name: Damaris Hayles
text: Very patient with my questions and helpful!

name: Annette Thomas
text: I've been there 3 times to get help and no one seems to know how to help me.

name: Deborah Aughtman
text: Made an appointment in advance, went straight in, took care of my business and out ,done in about 30 minutes or less

name: Donna Ranna
text: Found this very helpful

name: Rachael Stanczak
text: He was very helpful.
